text: Trying to wrap my head around developing modules locally in the updated local hubl server and how you would go about uploading a module in .json format to a portal
Any insight would be much appreciated

I haven't messed with the JSON but also very interested. Right now I'm building modules in a React Component-esque folder structure style, compiling, and then copy-pasting the code into the module editor; would love a way to automate the fields as well
I'm playing around with a file structure right now that, at the very least, will let me build modules in my preferred text editor.  Definitely feel like there's gotta be a better way though.
I'm hopeful with some of these local server improvements that have been teased that the experience should be better established soon.
coming from a wordpress background, I would love to see a similar local development experience.
We're actually starting to expand into WP here now and have been researching local dev solutions, mind if I shoot you a DM about your setup?

The json format is the same as what is expected by the API, so you should be able to just POST that to the custom-widgets endpoint. The latest local hubl server includes examples of the json for both old and new modules
A shame that you don't have documented that API :grin:...

But yeah, 
you are right, we can POST the data to: 
`<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets>`
*note: you need an APIKEY for that*
wow, you’re right. I assumed that API was documented. I’ll create an issue for that

I requested that time ago! but thank you!
I will be really happy with it
hello how to get my API Key ?
Click your profile icon in the top-right, then click *Integrations*. There should be a link in the sidebar there titled *HubSpot API Key*
